__e: I thought you didn't want me any more because I was a fool. I was disappointed and got weak, and life became bigger than me...
She's just a fool and you're far too good for her.
You are a tool, and I don't know what the hell I am.
You don't have to dumb it down for us, doctor.
You know, after talking to her, I feel pretty dumb that I ever thought there was anything between you and Heidi.
I may have been too shallow to marry Jeremy, But that doesn't mean I won't help him.
I know you think I'm stupid but I know this.
People think I'm a foolish, silly girl, but I ain't.
I know this seems small, even silly, but...
You're a very silly child, my dear.
This is from that silly girl I met at that party.
well, she looks at me... like I'm just the stupid, naked girl in Alex's bed.
I made a fool out of myself for coming in here like this.
I was a fool not to have realized it earlier, seeking all this time in the dust for that which may have been right before us all along.
As a matter of fact, I think you're a sucker to make it.
This is so silly. what does it matter who says it first?
It's about a young girl, a young and foolish girl, who sees something from her bedroom window which she doesn't understand, but she thinks she does.
And for what... a foolish girl who doesn't know her place?
